Public interfaces¶

Module selects samples with reconstruction error larger than 3 sigmas and removes outlier samples from final dataframe.

class outliers.Outliers(dataframe)[source]¶

Class identifying outliers.

dataframe¶

Dataframe to remove outliers on.

Type:

dataframe-like

model¶

Trained RNN model.

Type:

object

clean_dataframe(indexes)[source]¶

Removes sample of given indexes from dataframe.

Parameters:

indexes (list-like) -- List of indexes of samples to remove.

Returns:

Dataframe without outliers.

Return type:

dataframe

model_upload()[source]¶

Uploads trained autoencoder model from file to run on dataframe.

Returns:

model -- Trained RNN model

Return type:

object

outliers(nbins, plot_fit=False)[source]¶

Identifies ouliers using autoencoder.

Parameters:

  • nbins (integer-like) -- Number of bins for loss histogram.

  • plot_fit (boolean-like, default is False.) -- If True shows histogram of loss of replicated data and gaussian fit for outlier detection.

Returns:

indexes -- List of indexes of samples to remove.

Return type:

list-like

plot_distribution(indexes, feature)[source]¶

Plots feature distribution of removed samples from dataframe.

Parameters:

  • indexes (list-like) -- List of indexes of samples to remove as outliers.

  • feature (string-like) -- Feature to show in histogram

outliers.gaussian(x, x0, sigma, a)[source]¶

Gaussian function to use in fit.

outliers.sumgaussian(x, x0, x1, sigma0, sigma1, a, b)[source]¶

Sum of two gaussian function to possibly use in fit.

Module contains a class Preprocessing, with methods allowing to upload dataframe from file, add derived features, preprocess with some normalization options and harmonization options.

class preprocessing.Preprocessing[source]¶

Class containing functions for data

add_TotalWhiteVol(dataframe)[source]¶

Adds columns with derived features to dataframe.

Parameters:

dataframe (dataframe-like) -- The dataframe of raw data to be passed to the function.

add_age_binning(dataframe, bins=6)[source]¶

Creates a column called AGE_CLASS with AGE_AT_SCAN binning and attaches it to dataframe.

Parameters:

  • dataframe (dataframe-like) -- The dataframe of data to be passed to the function.

  • bins (integer-like, default is 6) -- Number of classes.

add_site(dataframe)[source]¶

Adds column with Site description.

Parameters:

dataframe (dataframe-like) -- Dataframe to be passed to the function.

add_site_binning(dataframe)[source]¶

Creates a map where SITE is binned in the column SITE_CLASS, then merges it with the dataframe.

Parameters:

dataframe (dataframe-like) -- Dataframe to be passed to the function.

Returns:

dataframe -- Dataframe with SITE_CLASS column.

Return type:

dataframe-like

com_harmonize(dataframe, confounder='SITE_CLASS', covariate='AGE_AT_SCAN')[source]¶

Harmonize dataset with ComBat model

Parameters:

  • dataframe (dataframe-like) -- Dataframe containing neuroimaging data to correct with shape = (samples, features). e.g. cortical thickness measurements, image voxels, etc

  • confounder (string-like, default is SITE_CLASS') -- Categorical feature to be accounted as confounder, which indicates batch (scanner) column name in covars.

  • covariate (string-like, default is 'AGE_AT_SCAN') -- Contains the batch/scanner covariate as well as additional covariates (optional) that should be preserved during harmonization.

Returns:

dataframe_harmonized -- Dataframe containing harmonized data

Return type:

dataframe-like

feature_selection(dataframe, feature='AGE_AT_SCAN', plot_heatmap=False)[source]¶

Select the feature whose correlation with the given feature is higher than 0.5.

Parameters:

  • dataframe (dataframe-like) -- Dataframe to be passed to the function.

  • feature (string-like, default is "AGE_AT_SCAN") -- Target feature on which to compute correlation.

  • plot_heatmap (boolean, default is False) -- If True, show heatmap of data correlation with feature.

Returns:

  • listoffeatures (list-like) -- List of selected features.

  • X (dataframe-like) -- Dataframe contraining only the columns relative to the selcted feature.

  • y (series-like) -- Series containg the target feauture on which correlation has been computed.

neuro_harmonize(dataframe, confounder='SITE', covariate='AGE_AT_SCAN')[source]¶

Harmonize dataset with neuroHarmonize model: 1-Load your data and all numeric covariates; 2-Run harmonization and store the adjusted data.

Parameters:

  • dataframe (dataframe-like) -- Dataframe to be passed to the function.

  • confounder (string-like, default is 'SITE') -- Feature to be accounted as confounder. Default is 'SITE'

  • covariate (string-like, default is 'AGE_AT_SCAN') -- Contains the batch/scanner covariate as well as additional covariates (optional) that should be preserved during harmonization.

Returns:

dataframe_harmonized -- Dataframe containing harmonized data

Return type:

dataframe-like

  • featurex (string-like) -- Feature in the x-axis of the boxplot.

  • featurey (string-like) -- Feature in the y-axis of the boxplot.

Module implements training in cross validation with K-fold and stratified K-fold.

class crossvalidation.Crossvalidation[source]¶

Class implementing model training in cross validation.

k_fold(X, y, n_splits, model)[source]¶

Fit and predict using cross validation with a model (or pipeline) supplied by the user.

Parameters:

  • X (type) -- Description of parameter X.

  • y (type) -- Description of parameter y.

  • n_splits (type) -- Description of parameter n_splits.

  • model (type) -- Description of parameter model.

Returns:

  • MAE (array) -- Mean absolute error obtained in cross validation.

  • MSE (array) -- Mean square error obtained in cross validation.

  • PR (array) -- Pearson coefficient obtained in cross validation.

stratified_k_fold(X, y, y_bins, n_splits, model)[source]¶

Fit and predict using stratified cross validation with a model (or pipeline) supplied by the user.

Parameters:

  • X (type) -- Description of parameter X.

  • y (type) -- Description of parameter y.

  • y_bins (type) -- Description of parameter y_bins.

  • n_splits (type) -- Description of parameter n_splits.

  • model (type) -- Description of parameter model.

Returns:

Description of returned object.

Return type:

type

Module implements a MLP and fits it on given dataframe.

class deepregression.DeepRegression(epochs=100, drop_rate=0.2, plot_loss=False)[source]¶

Class describing deep regression model.

Ordinary least squares Linear Regression. LinearRegression fits a linear model with coefficients w = (w1, ..., wp) to minimize the residual sum of squares between the observed targets in the dataset, and the targets predicted by the linear approximation. :param plot_loss: When set to True, plots the training and validation loss curves of the trained model :type plot_loss: bool, default=False

model¶
Type:

object

fit(X, y)[source]¶

Fit linear model. :param X: Training data. :type X: {array-like} of shape (n_samples, n_features) :param y: Target values. Will be cast to X's dtype if necessary. :type y: array-like of shape (n_samples,) or (n_samples, n_targets)

Returns:

self -- Fitted Estimator.

Return type:

object

predict(X)[source]¶

Describe predict function

Autoencoder trained comparing the output vector with the input features, using the Mean Squared Error (MSE) as loss function..

Custom step-wise function to use as activation for RNN.

  • N (integer) -- Number of steps. Default is 4.

  • a (integer) -- Tuning parameter. Default is 100.
